title: First CS class
body: In grade 11, I took my first CS class. I learned the fundamentals of Java and a little bit of object oriented programming, and I got to practice these skills by making 2D games with LibGDX.

title: Secondary School Programming Competition
body: Two of my friends and I placed 6th in the University of Windsor's secondary school programming competition, granting us each a $500 scholarship

title: Airfighter Project
body: My airfighter game project was the last project I made in high school, and is what sparked my love for programming. While I was working on this project, I decided to pursue a computer science degree.

title: Start of University
body: I began studying computer science at the University of Windsor.

title: Advanced to ICPC Regionals
body: My team placed second in the ICPC local qualifier at the University of Windsor and advanced to the Regional competition.

title: Volunteer CS Teaching Assistant
body: During my first semester of university I volunteered as a teaching assistant for my high school computer science teacher.

title: Dean's List and President's honour roll
body: I ended off my first year with a 93.8% cumulative average and a 95.7% major average, and received the Dean's List honour roll and President's honour roll

title: BorderHacks
body: I worked in a team of three to develop the CovidWallet app, listed in the projects view. This event sparked my interest to join more hackathons in the future.
